name: Fatima Abubakar Mala
role: Community Health Educator | Women & Youth Advocate
bio: Fatima Abubakar Mala is a passionate Community Health Educator and youth mentor based in Borno State, Nigeria. A proud graduate of 2025, she focuses on maternal and child health, sanitation, and preventive education for women in rural communities. Through workshops and storytelling, Fatima translates complex health topics into simple, relatable lessons that help families make safer everyday choices. She has led awareness campaigns on malaria prevention, hygiene promotion, and nutrition, empowering hundreds of mothers and students. Her vision is to create a healthier, better-informed generation through empathy, education, and action.

cards.title: Areas of Expertise
cards.content: Maternal & Child Health, Community Mobilization, Hygiene & Nutrition Education, Health Communication, Youth Leadership

cards.title: Achievements
cards.content: Led 5+ health outreach programs reaching over 800 women and adolescents; featured in Talk2Health podcast for her impactful field storytelling.

cards.title: Focus & Vision
cards.content: Fatima believes that lasting health change begins with understanding. She aims to bridge the gap between health institutions and community realities through compassionate education.
